solution_line_template: {tables_with_2_chairs} tables have {chairs_per_table_2} chairs each for a total of {tables_with_2_chairs}*{chairs_per_table_2} = <<{tables_with_2_chairs}*{chairs_per_table_2}={chairs_from_2_chair_tables}>>{chairs_from_2_chair_tables} chairs

{tables_with_3_chairs} tables have {chairs_per_table_3} chairs each for a total of {tables_with_3_chairs}*{chairs_per_table_3} = <<{tables_with_3_chairs}*{chairs_per_table_3}={chairs_from_3_chair_tables}>>{chairs_from_3_chair_tables} chairs

{tables_with_4_chairs} tables have {chairs_per_table_4} chairs each for a total of {tables_with_4_chairs}*{chairs_per_table_4} = <<{tables_with_4_chairs}*{chairs_per_table_4}={chairs_from_4_chair_tables}>>{chairs_from_4_chair_tables} chairs

The total number of chairs is {chairs_from_2_chair_tables}+{chairs_from_3_chair_tables}+{chairs_from_4_chair_tables} = <<{chairs_from_2_chair_tables}+{chairs_from_3_chair_tables}+{chairs_from_4_chair_tables}={total_chairs}>>{total_chairs} chairs
